items: Start in a plank position with your shoulders over your wrists and your body in a straight line.
Lower your body down towards the ground, keeping your elbows close to your sides.
Stop when your arms are at a 90-degree angle and your body is hovering just above the ground.
Hold this position for a few breaths, then push back up into plank pose.
Repeat for several repetitions, making sure to engage your core and keep your body in a straight line throughout the movement.
Relieves tension in the chest and front of the shoulders
Improves posture by opening up the chest and shoulders
Increases flexibility in the chest and shoulders
May help alleviate upper back pain
Can be done anywhere without equipment
